content.webTitle: Queen photobombs Hockeyroo Jayde Taylor’s Commonwealth Games selfie

fields.headline: Queen photobombs Hockeyroo Jayde Taylor’s Commonwealth Games selfie
fields.bodyText: Two years after her starring role in the London 2012 opening ceremony, the Queen has gone viral again after appearing to photobomb an Australian hockey player’s selfie. Jayde Taylor, one of the players introduced to the Queen at the Glasgow National Hockey Centre on Thursday, took the photo to mark the moment, and when she saw the result, shared it on Twitter. The Queen and the Duke of Edinburgh watched Australia beat Malaysia 4-0 on the first day of action in Glasgow, with the scorers Jodie Kenny, Kellie White and Georgie Parker, twice. The Australia side played the match wearing black armbands in memory of the victims of the MH17 disaster. Defender Anna Flanagan said: “It has really affected our country, and we wanted to show our love and support.”
